subjective: Patient presents today complaining of chronic migraine which started approximately 2 weeks ago. They describe the pain/discomfort as a 4/10. Patient reports difficulty sleeping due to the symptoms. They deny any recent trauma or travel.
objective: Vitals: BP 117/89, HR 93, Temp 99.0F. Physical exam reveals tenderness in the affected area if applicable. No acute distress noted. Lungs are clear to auscultation.
assessment: Findings are consistent with Hypertension. Differential diagnosis includes viral etiology or stress-related exacerbation.
plan: 1. Start Metformin 500mg once daily. 2. Follow up in 4 weeks if symptoms do not improve. 3. Patient education provided regarding lifestyle changes and warning signs.
